title: Utilization is the ratio of used capacity to total capacity
text:
Link utilization is defined as:
$$\text{Utilization} = \frac{\text{actual throughput on the link}}{\text{link capacity}}$$

For each server link, the actual throughput is limited by the smallest capacity along the end-to-end path. From the previous analysis:

Each pair’s throughput = $$\min(R_S, R/4, R_C) = \min(50, 75, 90) = 50\ \text{Mbps}$$

Server link capacity = $$R_S = 50\ \text{Mbps}$$
